textos_fuente.text: Island Hospitality Management | Official Site SKIP TO CONTENT Our Company Our Team Our History Services Portfolio IHM Outdoors New Collection Properties News & Press Careers Benefits Diversity Pathways Apply Now 561-655-9001 Welcome Results Driven by People & Processes At Island Hospitality our Proprietary Technology, Hands-On Management, and Talent Development Programs are the cornerstones to our company's culture in third party management for the world‚Äôs most recognizable hotel brands. Our team works with owners to develop tailored solutions to maximize revenue while implementing proven efficiencies and aggressive cost containment tools that deliver an immediate and meaningful impact on the bottom line. What We Offer Purchasing Services Purchasing Services We leverage our strong relationships with top suppliers and brands and the power of our volume purchasing to negotiate better pricing on commodities used consistently across our properties, passing significant savings on to you. Learn More Sales & Marketing Support Sales & Marketing Support Our sales team drives business directly to our¬†investor properties using an integrated system of sales activity data, targeted e-commerce strategies, social media management, cross-selling initiatives, and more. Learn More Revenue Management Revenue Management Our revenue managers use cutting-edge systems to anticipate and capitalize on revenue opportunities, focusing closely on market share and performance to ensure all revenue expectations are met. Learn More Human Resources Human Resources Our Pathways Human Resources program ensures that our in-house teams and investors‚Äô properties are staffed with the industry‚Äôs top talent, creating meaningful career opportunities and advancement for hospitality professionals. Learn More Accounting & Financial Services Accounting & Financial Services We create a significant competitive advantage for investors with the use of data-driven forecasting through our use of proprietary technology. We offer a full suite of accounting and financial services to suit every owners needs. Learn More Operational Systems Operational Systems By using a multi-faceted system known as COMET Data Flow & Integration, we effectively report on analytics, sales, finances, and human capital management with a results-driven approach. Learn More A Look at Our Portfolio Island Hospitality's portfolio consists of premium brand hotels and resorts in desirable locations throughout the United States. The Inns Staff | The Inns of Sanibel Mobile Menu Close Home Sanibel Inn Experiences Close Back to main menu Experiences Learn More Tennis & Pickleball Water Activities Club Membership Beaches Biking Shelling Shopping Yard Games Cookouts & Campfires Dining The Dunes Weddings Gallery Promotions Book a Tee Time ‚Äì Public (maximum five days advance) Book a Tee Time ‚Äì¬†Full Club Members Book a Tee Time ‚Äì Tennis & Sports Members BeachCam Skip to main content Search for: Search [{"text":"Sanibel Inn","id":0,"selected":false,"title":"Sanibel Inn","subtitle":"Where the Nature Meets the sea","icon":"starfish","url":"https:\/\/www.theinnsofsanibel.com\/the-inns\/sanibel-inn\/"},{"text":"The Dunes Golf & Tennis Club","id":1,"selected":false,"title":"The Dunes Golf & Tennis Club","subtitle":"","icon":"golf-clubs","url":"https:\/\/dunesgolfsanibel.com\/"}] BeachCam Tel Free: (866) 717-2323 Search Menu Search Home Sanibel Inn Experiences Recreation Overview Close Tennis & Pickleball Water Activities Club Membership Beaches Biking Shelling Shopping Yard Games Cookouts & Campfires Dining The Dunes Weddings Gallery Promotions Check Availability Check Availability Close Sanibel Inn Seaside Inn Sunset Beach Inn Song of the Sea Inn Date format: mm/dd/yyyy Arrival September 9 Departure September 10 Guest Check Availability Tel Free: (866) 717-2323 Check Availability Header Item 1 The Inns Staff Home The Inns The Inns Staff Bill Wellman - General Manager A 35-year hospitality management veteran, Bill is passionate about hospitality and tourism, and he‚Äôs excited about what he and his staff do every day ‚Äì create vacations of a lifetime for guests on one of the most beautiful islands in the world. Bill previously managed the Campus Inn for Dahlmann Properties and later the Graduate Madison in Wisconsin, where he served as the President of the Madison Hotel & Lodging Association and board member for the Greater Madison Convention and Visitor's Bureau. He spent the first 16 years of his career with Walt Disney Resorts in various leadership roles and property openings. He and his wife and daughter enjoy visiting new countries and traveling the world. David Lopez - Assistant General Manager David began his hospitality career in Miami Beach as a concierge while attending FIU's school of Hospitality Management. In 2014, he moved to Key West to be a part of Casa Marina and the Reach resorts, both part of the prestigious Waldorf Astoria collection. During his time there he grew to become VIP manager, Manager of Guest Experience and Front Office Manager, leading his teams not only to raise their service scores but also to become one of the top revenue generating hotels across the Hilton portfolio. In 2019, he moved to Fort Myers and accepted his role as Assistant General Manager at the Inns of Sanibel. Victor Lohmuste - Director of Engineering Victor is originally from Estonia. He emigrated to Italy in 1989 with family and a year later to Fort Myers. While in Estonia, Victor created about 50 patents in his name. He also worked for an auto repair business for 8 years, was a private estate manager in Naples for 5 years, and a real estate maintenance manager for Levitt and Sons over 5 years. Victor has been a part of the Inns of Sanibel team for more than a decade. Victor received his Diploma and Certification for HVACR Technician from Penn Foster career school. His hobbies include triathlons, photography, and red wine and his favorite band is Pink Floyd. Carol Gilmore - Director of Finance Carol is originally from Minnesota and is a University of Minnesota graduate. She started her hotel career at the Lodge at Vail in Colorado before moving to Florida. Carol worked at Sonesta Sanibel Harbor Resort, before becoming the Accounting Manager for the Mariner company back in the 90s, which owned the four Inns of Sanibel, The Dunes, South Seas, Sundial, and the Pink Shell. She started at the Inns, then 12 years later worked at South Seas as Assistant Controller. She returned to the Inns of Sanibel as Controller and added the Sundial and The Dunes to her collection totaling 25 years of service. Brad Stanze - Area Front Office Manager A Florida native, Brad kicked off his hospitality career after high school working at a Pine Island KOA campground. Later, he traveled extensively with Kimpton Hotels to Colorado, Massachusetts, West Virginia and the DMV area as a front office supervisor, and in sales and marketing. During his free time you will find him working his other "full-time job" - being a dad to two wonderful kids! Kayla Lawrence ‚Äì Innkeeper, Sanibel Inn Before joining the team at Sanibel Inn, Kayla worked on Sanibel Island for over a decade in various retail positions from front-line sales to management. She currently attends FGCU and plans to graduate in the Fall of 2022 with a BS in Hospitality Resort Management. Kayla is committed to assisting her team in delivering exceptional guest service and to creating memorable moments that last a lifetime. In her spare time, Kayla enjoys boating and searching for shells on Sanibel Island's breathtaking beaches. Amanda Low - Innkeeper, Song of the Sea Amanda has a wealth of experience in hospitality, food & beverage and bridal consultation from her work in Washington state and sunny Florida. She is currently studying for a BA in Communications, as well as certifications in wedding planning, event planning, and event decor. Amanda prides herself on her exceptional organizational skills and passion for delivering personalized service, which makes her a perfect fit for The Inns of Sanibel! In her free time, she enjoys going to the gym, reading, and spending time with her family and boyfriend. Amber Serradimigni - Innkeeper, Seaside Inn Before relocating to Florida, Amber worked as an office manager in upstate New York. She brings with her a strong focus on customer satisfaction and a drive to promote brand confidence. Amber graduated from The Adirondack Dental Assisting School in 2019 with the distinction of Valedictorian before shifting direction into hospitality. She has been working for The Inns of Sanibel since 2020, and has a passion for helping guests create memorable experiences. Amber enjoys cooking and spending time outdoors with her fiance and her dog Yoshi. Anvar Ruziev - Innkeeper, Sunset Beach Born in Ukraine and raised in Colorado, Anvar is a former small business owner, currently working towards a BA in Economics with a minor in Spanish. In addition, he is fluent in Russian and Ukrainian. Having visited 10 different countries, and 42 of the 50 states, Anvar has a deep understanding of tourism. A consummate professional with years of hospitality experience, he strives to achieve and exceed expectations of every guest. His hobbies include open water swimming, exploring the Florida coast, and aerial photography. Testimonials ‚ÄúWe stayed in a top floor king room suite which was beautifully laid out and comfortable. Grounds were gorgeous! We met the owners who were very friendly and meticulous in the details of the resort...Would recommend staying at this quiet, conveniently located, high scale retreat.‚Äù Betty B. ‚Äî Feb 2025 ‚ÄúWhat a perfect Inn to stay at on Sanibel Island. The staff were incredible, a special shout out to Mikey and Kayla for an outstanding response to our needs. They are very caring and only want their guests to feel welcome and at home. The rooms were immaculate and the grounds were beautiful. The renovations they have done make it a perfect spot for a vacation. Our first visit to Sanibel Island, but not our last. We will be staying here again. Thank you for a wonderful trip to your island.‚Äù Judy ‚Äî Feb 2025 ‚ÄúThe wait is over. The Sanibel Inn has reopened its doors to paradise. As usual, we had an absolutely wonderful time. The rooms are very comfortable and designed with a coastal feel with many upgrades. The grounds are very tropical and will look amazing once everything is in full bloom. It was wonderful to see some familiar faces, Kayla and Tyrone and meet new ones too. Tyrone, Jorge and Mamuka at the Beach Hut had our chairs and umbrella set up on the beach every morning. The staff was super friendly and always looking to help make your stay more memorable. Kudos to the general manager, Bill Wellman for making the reopening such a success. WE have already booked our return in September. Can't wait!‚Äù Anne ‚Äî Feb 2025, St. Augustine, Florida ‚ÄúAmazing Beautiful Resort!!! Everything is redone, remodeled and brand new!!! Pool and Tikibar area were stunning, Brand new bicycles are free to guests with brand name PRIORITY...Great Stay, Awesome Staff and Beautiful Grounds! We will be back!!!!‚Äù Msdet1529 ‚Äî March 2025 ‚ÄúOur stay at Sanibel Inn exceeded our hopes and expectations. The new accommodations are top-notch. Two restaurants (one in a lovely outdoor setting) make it possible to stay on the property and ‚Äúveg-out.‚Äù The pool is steps from the rooms, and the beautiful beachfront is right there across a new boardwalk. The heart and soul to rebuild after Ian is evident in the tasteful decor, beautifully planned grounds and new plantings, and environmentally conscious infrastructure. Highly recommend!‚Äù C6107JWsusanp ‚Äî May 2025 Sign up for exclusive offers‚Äìdirect to your inbox Full Name * Email Address * * By checking this box you agree to our terms and conditions . Additionally, this site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. Captcha Name This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged. The Island Inn on Martha's Vineyard ‚Äì Coastal Comfort, Vineyard Charm Skip to content Rooms Amenities Rental Policies Food & Beverage Events Event Center Location Things to Do Vineyard Blog Resort Map Contact Rooms Amenities Rental Policies Food & Beverage Events Event Center Location Things to Do Vineyard Blog Resort Map Contact 508.693.2002 Book Now Welcome to the Island Inn Your Island Home Away from Home on Martha's Vineyard Immerse yourself in the charm and tranquility of our inviting retreat, perfectly nestled just moments from pristine beaches and vibrant island attractions. BOOK NOW Contact Us Follow us: Facebook-f Icon-instagram-1 Youtube Tiktok Relaxation, Comfort, and Island Hospitality Enjoy the island experience Discover the perfect New England escape at The Island Inn on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. Nestled on five acres of serene coastal charm, this year-round resort offers the ideal blend of relaxation and convenience. Whether you‚Äôre planning a family vacation, romantic retreat, or group getaway, The Island Inn provides a warm, welcoming atmosphere and exceptional vacation rentals for every traveler. Years of Experience 0 + Professional Staffs 0 + Awards & Recognitions 0 + Positive Reviews 0 % About the island inn Accommodations Tailored to Your Needs Explore 51 thoughtfully appointed vacation rentals, from cozy studios to spacious multi-room suites, all designed to make you feel at home. Enjoy popular amenities like well-equipped kitchens, comfortable living spaces, and access to on-site features such as tennis courts, an outdoor pool, and lush green grounds. Learn More Our Rooms Discover Comfort in Every Stay View More Units ‚Äì 3-6, 7, 9, 11-14, 17-20, 22, 23-27 Building B, C, D, F Studio Suites Perfect for couples or small groups, our studio units provide a cozy and comfortable stay with room for up to four guests. Featuring a convenient kitchenette, cable TV, free WiFi, and shared access to resort amenities like the outdoor pool, tennis courts, and grilling area, these studios are ideal for a relaxing retreat near the beach and golf course. 4 People 2 Double Beds 1 Bathroom Book This Room Units ‚Äì 8, 10, 15, 16 Building C, D One Bedroom Suites Our one-bedroom Suites offer a blend of comfort and functionality, accommodating up to four or six guests. Enjoy the privacy of a separate bedroom, a well-equipped kitchenette, and a cozy living area. Relax on the patio or deck and take advantage of on-site amenities, including the seasonal pool, Har-Tru clay tennis courts, and picnic areas. 4 People 1 Queen and 1 Sofa Bed 1 Bathroom Book This Room Unit ‚Äì 1, 2 Building A Two Bedroom Suites The Two-Bedroom Suites at The Island Inn on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard provide a spacious retreat for families or groups, featuring two private bedrooms, a cozy living area, and a fully equipped kitchenette for preparing meals. These suites offer modern amenities such as free Wi-Fi, a flat-screen TV, and climate control, ensuring comfort and convenience throughout your stay. 4 People 1 Queen and 2 Single Beds 1 Bathroom Book This Room Unit ‚Äì 21 Building E Cottage‚Äã The Cottage at The Island Inn on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard offers a charming and spacious retreat perfect for families or small groups. Featuring 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and accommodating up to 6 guests, this cozy cottage combines comfort and coastal style. Inside, you‚Äôll find airy living spaces with high ceilings, a bright, welcoming d√©cor, and thoughtfully designed rooms. 6 People 2 Kingbeds 2 Bathrooms Book This Room Units ‚Äì 30-39 Building G Residential Suites Comfortable and thoughtfully appointed, these one-bedroom residential suites offer a relaxed island feel with space for up to five guests. Each suite features a private bedroom with a queen bed, a living area with two twin beds and a sleeper sofa, and one full bathroom. A fully equipped kitchen or kitchenette includes essentials like a stove, microwave, refrigerator, and dishwasher in select units. Guests also enjoy complimentary WiFi, cable TV, air conditioning, and tasteful coastal d√©cor. Ideal for families or small groups, these suites provide the flexibility of home with the ease of a vacation stay. 4 People 1 Queen, 2 Single, and 1 Sofa Beds 1 Bathroom Book This Room Units ‚Äì 40, 43, 45, 46, 51 Building G Two Bedroom & 1.5 Bath Townhouses‚Äã These spacious, two-level townhouses are ideal for families or groups seeking comfort and flexibility. Each unit features two bedrooms‚Äîtypically one with a king bed and the other with two twin beds‚Äîas well as a semi-private loft-style layout. A full bathroom is located on the lower level, while a convenient half bath is available upstairs. The open-concept living area includes a sleeper sofa, cable TV, and complimentary WiFi, creating a relaxed gathering space. 4 People 1 King and 2 Single Beds 1.5 Bathrooms Book This Room Units ‚Äì 41, 42, 44, 47-50 Building G Two Bedroom & 2 Bath Townhouses These spacious and thoughtfully designed two-bedroom, two-bath townhouses offer an elevated residential stay for families and small groups. Each unit features one bedroom with a king bed and another with two twin beds, plus a double sleeper sofa in the living area. The two full bathrooms‚Äîtypically one on each level‚Äîoffer added convenience and privacy. With vaulted ceilings, coastal-inspired furnishings, and a functional layout, these multi-level units include a fully equipped kitchen or kitchenette, dining space, and a comfortable living area with cable TV and free WiFi. Many townhomes feature semi-private or lofted bedroom spaces, and all offer step-out balconies or decks perfect for relaxing after a day at the beach. Central or partial air conditioning ensures a comfortable indoor climate, and guests will find ample room to unpack and unwind throughout their stay 4 People 1 King and 2 Single Beds 2 Bathrooms Book This Room Amenities Enhance Your Island Escape Indulge in our thoughtful amenities designed to elevate your stay. Free Wifi Complimentary Wi-Fi
Stay connected effortlessly during your visit. Outdoor Pool Relax and refresh in our heated swimming pool Laundry On-site coin-operated laundry facilities Tennis Courts Enjoy our professionally maintained Har-Tru tennis courts. Reservations required, additional fee applies. Nomans Enjoy dining at Nomans, conveniently located next door to The Island Inn‚Äã Full Kitchens Each unit includes a kitchen or kitchenette, ideal for extended stays or quick bites. Dedicated Parking No need to worry about parking‚Äîevery unit comes with its own reserved space Pet-Friendly Tail-wagging stays start here! Select accommodations are pet-friendly. Outdoor Amenities Enjoy community BBQs, fire pits, picnic areas, and a playground‚Äîall just steps from your door. Unwind in the Heart of Martha's Vineyard Charm Dining Enjoy dining at Nomans, conveniently located next door to The Island Inn (independently owned and operated) See the menu Near Destinations Explore the Best of Martha‚Äôs Vineyard Inkwell Beach 3 min drive 20 min walking Joseph Sylvia State Beach 4 min drive 7 min biking Farm Neck Golf Club 8 min drive 12 min biking Circuit Avenue Shopping 4 min drive 15 min walking Flying Horses Carousel 4 min drive 8 min biking East Chop Lighthouse 9 min drive 15 min biking Edgartown Village 9 min drive 22 min biking The Steamship Authority Oak Bluffs Terminal 4 min drive 7 min biking Hear what people have to say Reviews View More Lisa R. Guest We have stayed here 3 times. So great to have a beautiful, clean pool on these hot days. Customer service is exceptional. Units are clean & stocked with utensils/pots & pans for cooking if you choose. Grills & fire pits on the property too. Close to OB, Edgartown & beaches. We‚Äôll be back for sure. Luaren C. Guest A little bit of heaven What a wonderful experience from the minute we checked in until the minute we left. The grounds are beautiful our room was beautiful clean. The staff was absolutely amazing. Friendly helpful and always willing to assist. Smiles and kind words all the way around as well as the other people who were staying on grounds as well. It was just a wonderful wonderful experience and we will be back Jenna G. Guest Everything about this place is perfect. You‚Äôre close to beaches, to Oak Bluffs, to the Jaws Bridge. I would definitely revisit the Island Inn. Rooms were like little studio apartments , full kitchen and dining table. Always clean. In the building I was in, you shared a deck with the other rooms on your floor. It looked like some buildings were little cottages but mine had 5 rooms on the first floor and 5 on the second. FYI‚Ä¶No elevator, outside entry. There‚Äôs a pool, playground, big grassy area for other lawn games. 10/10 I would recommend Nathalie V. Guest We took bikes for the weekend to watch marathon! Perfect location ‚Äì clean- and kept bikes locked in front porch which was undercover. Easy to jump on bus #13 to get groceries and head into oakbluffs for dinner. Would love to stay again! GREAT STAFF! Susan R. Guest My husband, son and i were happily surprised as soon as we arrived at the island inn office. Tony was super courteous and helpful, as was Chelsea. Unit 41g was so much nicer than we expected. The unit is decorated with care‚Äîthe owner clearly has great taste and carefully thought out how to make the unit feel vacationey but homey. Danielle V. Guest Fantastic stay. Perfect lodging with hotel-like amenities. Excellent location. Clean, wonderful space with great taste, elevated condo upgrades (AC, TV and channels for adults and kids; fans; shades, easy to access) and amenities, great for family of 4. We will be back! FAQs Frequently Asked Questions General Information Check-In & Policies Amenities Pets Location & Transportation Booking & Contact Where is The Island Inn located? The Island Inn is located at 30 Island Inn Road, Oak Bluffs, MA 02557 , conveniently positioned between Oak Bluffs and Edgartown. What accommodations are available? We offer studio suites, one- and two-bedroom suites, townhouses, and a cottage, each equipped with kitchenettes or full kitchens. Is The Island Inn family-friendly? Yes! Our spacious accommodations, outdoor pool, playground, and lawn areas make us perfect for families. What are the check-in and check-out times? Check-in: 3:00 PM Check-out: 10:00 AM What is your cancellation policy? Full refund if canceled within 24 hours of booking. 50% refund if canceled 15‚Äì29 days before arrival. No refunds within 14 days of arrival. Is there an age requirement to check in? Guests must be at least 21 years old to check in. Are events or parties allowed? No, parties and events are not permitted . What are the quiet hours? Quiet hours are from 10:00 PM to 8:00 AM daily. What amenities does The Island Inn offer? Outdoor heated pool Har-Tru tennis courts (fee applies, reservations required) Playground area Landscaped grounds Coin-operated laundry Complimentary Wi-Fi Free parking Do accommodations have kitchens? Yes, every unit includes a kitchenette or a full kitchen with necessary appliances. Are pets allowed? Yes, dogs are welcome in select pet-friendly units with advance approval. Fees apply: Pet cleaning fee: $150 per stay Nightly fee: $20 per dog (up to two dogs per unit, size restrictions may apply) Cats are not permitted. Service animals are welcome free of charge. How far is The Island Inn from downtown Oak Bluffs? We‚Äôre located approximately 1 mile from downtown Oak Bluffs, offering easy access to shops, dining, and entertainment. How close is the nearest beach? Joseph Sylvia State Beach is about 0.5 miles away. Is there public transportation nearby? Yes, Martha‚Äôs Vineyard Transit Authority (VTA) buses have stops nearby, connecting you to all island attractions. How do I make a reservation? Book directly via our website: www.islandinnmv.com . Who can I contact for additional questions? Call us at 508-693-2002 or email info@islandinnmv.com . Blog & News Blog & Articles About Martha's Vineyard View More Charming Stays. Timeless Memories Home About Reservations Vineyard Blog Contact Address 30 Island Inn Rd. Our History | Island Hospitality Management SKIP TO CONTENT Our Company Our Team Our History Services Portfolio IHM Outdoors New Collection Properties News & Press Careers Benefits Diversity Pathways Apply Now 561-655-9001 Our History Our Company Our Team Our History Hands-On In the Beginning Island Hospitality grew from its first property - The Hampton Inn West Palm Beach in 1985 - to become one of the country‚Äôs most admired hotel management companies. About Jeffrey H. Fisher An accomplished hotelier and hospitality industry leader, Jeff Fisher serves as the Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of the Board, and President of Chatham Lodging Trust. Previously, Fisher served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Innkeepers USA and currently serves on the Board of Marriott‚Äôs Residence Inn Association. 2024 IHM expands adding 3 branded hotels to its portfolio in Syracuse, Boca Raton, and Phoenix. 2023 IHM becomes the exclusive hotel manager for The Winslow Hotels and launches IHM Outdoors, a new division focused on outdoor and resort hospitality. 2022 IHM expands adding 14 hotels to its portfolio with a new presence in Baltimore & Phoenix. 2021 Added 8 hotels with continued growth in Austin, Los Angeles, DC and Charlotte. 2020 IHM becomes the exclusive hotel manager for the new extended stay brand WaterWalk, the 5th hotel created by Jack DeBoer. 2015 With additional portfolio acquisitions, IHM grows to manage over 170 hotels. 2014 IHM successfully onboards two major portfolio acquisitions. 2010 IHM partners with Chatham Lodging Trust. 2007 IHM manages over 80 hotels, including new full-service properties. 2003 The company manages over 70 hotels after acquiring 27 Residence Inns. 1999 JF Hotels officially changes its name to Island Hospitality Management and has 40 hotels under management. 1994 JF Hotels begins managing extended stay hotels. 1985 JF Hotels is founded and assumes management of the newly constructed Hampton Inn West Palm Beach. sign up Contact Us facebook instagram linkedin Thank you for your interest.
